rename.from: Recyler could use a LIFO local structure instead of an ArrayDeque
rename.to: Recycler could use a LIFO local structure instead of an ArrayDeque

body: You can also the ArrayDeque as a stack.
@chrisvest i didn't check it, but yes, I suppose it would work efficiently (removing/adding from the top) the same...in short, this issue can be a one liner...
@franz1981 I agree in "theory" this sound like some low-hanging fruit that should give some perf win.
@franz1981 could you please assign the issue to me?

issue.title: Replace ArrayDeque::pollFirst with ArrayDeque::pollLast for Recycler.LocalPool batch. (#14268)

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

Improve performance by replacing ArrayDeque::pollFirst with ArrayDeque::pollLast.

Modifications:

Replaced ArrayDeque::pollFirst with ArrayDeque::pollLast for LocalPool batch.

Result:
- The new version shows the best overall performance in benchmarks such as plainNew, recyclerGetAndRecycle, and unguardedProducerConsumer.
- Overall, the new version shows a significant reduction in GC time, improving memory efficiency across most tests.

Fixes #14268
